answerText: "The Tomb of Edgar Poe" [or "Le Tombeau d'Edgar Poe"][10] "The Tomb of Edgar Poe" was written by this author who wrote how "All thought expresses" the title action in the poem "A Throw of the Dice Will Never Abolish Chance." He also wrote The Afternoon of a Faun.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 12 | 10 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This poem exclaims, "what grief! / If understanding cannot sculpt a bas-relief / To ornament the dazzling" title object. For 10 points each: [10] Name this poem that tells how "at last eternity changes him / The Poet reawakens with a naked sword."
